questions.question: Why is requirements traceability important in software development?
answers: It enables tracking of requirements throughout the development process
It determines the project's return on investment
It ensures that requirements are not changed
t helps in creating user stories

questions.question: In Agile development, what is the primary responsibility of a Scrum Master?
answers: Writing code and developing features
Managing the project budget
Ensuring the team follows Agile principles and practices
Creating user stories and acceptance criteria

questions.question: What is the purpose of a Burndown Chart in Agile development?
answers: To measure the project's return on investment
To track the team's progress in completing tasks over time
To visualize the team's skill levels
To display the hierarchy of user stories

questions.question: what does software architecture include?
answers: Only the structural aspects of a system
Only the behavioral aspects of a system
The interactions between a system and its environment
The fundamental organization, components, and design principles of a system

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of program testing?
answers: To execute a program with real-world data
To identify as many requirements as possible
To discover defects before the program is put into use
To verify the software's non-functional attributes

questions.question: What is the primary focus of software maintenance?
answers: Modifying a program after it has been put into use
Developing new software from scratch
Creating different versions of custom software
Developing generic software products

questions.question: In adaptive and perfective maintenance, what does the maintenance programmer need to be an expert in?
answers: implementation and integration
New programming languages
testing and documentation
Requirements,Specifications,Design,and Implementation and integration

questions.question: When designing a survey in software engineering, what is a crucial consideration?
answers: Using complex technical language
Focusing on positive feedback
Excluding open-ended questions
The length of the survey

questions.question: What is the purpose of using architectural patterns in software development?
answers: To document the project budget
To estimate the return on investment
To provide reusable solutions to commonly occurring problems
To assign tasks to team members

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of conductive surveys in software engineering?
answers: To gather user feedback on software performance
To collect data on specific software-related topics
To promote new software releases
To identify and fix bugs in the software

questions.question: Why is scalability an important consideration in software architecture?
answers: It determines the project timeline
It ensures that the software has a visually appealing design
It focuses on the security aspects of the software
It addresses the system's ability to handle growth in users

questions.question: What is the main distinction between validation testing and defect testing?
answers: The use of artificial data in validation testing
The intentional obscurity of test cases in defect testing
The focus on system crashes in defect testing
The expectation of correct performance in validation testing
